DataElement.preferredName: Blood Specimen Other Diseases and Disorders Research Consent Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient's blood may be kept for research about other health problems (e.g., causes of diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, and heart disease).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Blood Specimen Other Diseases and Disorders Research Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to consent for the use of a blood specimen for research on other abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Other Diseases and Disorders Research Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient's Initial Consent giv
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient's Initial Consent given for blood specimen use for research unrelated to the patient's cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her blood to be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Your blood samples may be used for research about other diseases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her blood to be kept for use research about other health problems (for example: causes of diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, and heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her blood to be kept for use in research about other health problems (for example: causes of diabetes, Alzheimer's disease or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to keep blood sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease). This may also include genetic research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for her blood to be kept for use in research about other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her blood samples for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to the Alliance to store and use his/her blood samples for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you obtained the patient's consent for his or her blood to be kept for use in research about other health problems (for example: causes of diabetes, Alzheimer's disease and heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: My blood may be kept for use in research about other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her blood/plasma sample for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use blood sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her blood sample(s) for use in future research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
